title: Financial Literacy: Nearly 9 Out of 10 Adults Say States Should Require Financial Education - GOBankingRates
content: Financial Literacy: Nearly 9 Out of 10 Adults Say States Should Require Financial Education  GOBankingRates
description: If you think kids should acquire more financial literacy before graduating from high school, you have plenty of company. The overwhelming majority of U.S. adults say financial education should be required in schools, according to a new survey from the National Endowment for Financial Education (NEFE). See: How Financial Literacy Changes Once You're RetiredFind: Today's Teens Lack Financial Literacy Skills, Fear Rising College & Trade School Costs The survey of 1,030 Americans 18 and older, conducted in March and released on Monday, found that 88% of respondents said their states should require high school students to take either a semester- or year-long financial education course before they can graduate. Eighty percent said they wish they had been required to take financial education courses in high school.
